intro: Calathiana verna subsp. tergestina, commonly known as the Sicilian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe, particularly Sicily. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. It is a perennial herb with slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. The subspecies tergestina is distinguished by its smaller flowers and specific geographic distribution compared to the broader species.
